bug.author: engr3os
bug.summary: Hamming distance CPU test failure on 32-bit
bug.description:
Hi, I am trying execute "make runtest" and met some problems. The caffe is successfully compiled on Ubuntu14.04 with CPU only. When executing the testcases, it got stuck on function : ReferenceHammingDistance(n, x, y) [----------] 8 tests from CPUMathFunctionsTest/1, where TypeParam = double [ RUN ] CPUMathFunctionsTest/1.TestNothing [ OK ] CPUMathFunctionsTest/1.TestNothing (62 ms) [ RUN ] CPUMathFunctionsTest/1.TestHammingDistance src/caffe/test/test_math_functions.cpp:86: Failure Value of: caffe_cpu_hamming_distance(n, x, y) Actual: 712929 Expected: this->ReferenceHammingDistance(n, x, y) Which is: 1413025 [ FAILED ] CPUMathFunctionsTest/1.TestHammingDistance, where TypeParam = double (62 ms) The test finally aborted due to this. I saw there was similar problem in some old thread but indication it was actually solved. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/BVLC/caffe/issues/1294>#1294</denchmark-link>
Can someone help?
